title: What is considered the late 20th century? - Quora

response.answer_text: The divisions are arbitrary. But one might for example define the “early 20th century” as lasting until the October 1929 crash in the New York financial markets. That means the “middle 20th century” can begin then, encompass the depression and second world war, and perhaps extend until the rise of OPEC and its awareness of its price setting power regarding crude oil, which redefined power politics considerable. So let’s say 1929 - 1973 for the middle of the century. And let’s define the END of the period not by the calendar but by an event even more of a world shatterer than the ones we’ve already mentioned. The late 20th century ended when the planes hit the towers: again in New York. This gives us our answer to your question: 1973 - 2001.

Well the last quartile (1/4) would be from 1975–2000, while the last quintile (1/5) would be from 1980–2000. Late 20th Century is a nice general term covering some fraction from 1/2 to 1/10 of a 100 year period called strangely enough a century, from the Latin term for 100. Also in cent for 1/100th of a dollar. J
